intro: Dendragrostis, commonly known as the golden saxifrage, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous perennials with distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. They are characterized by their upright, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Dendragrostis species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. They thrive in moist, well-drained soils and are often found in woodland or alpine environments.
